description: Actinic Solar Damage, also known as Telangiectasia, is a skin condition caused by prolonged exposure to ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun. It results in the dilation of small blood vessels near the surface of the skin, leading to the appearance of red or purple spider veins.
symptoms: Visible red or purple spider veins on the skin
treatments: Sun protection measures (e.g., sunscreen, protective clothing)
